website_summaries.verdict: A premium, rotating floor stand that is compatible with the iPad Air, Samsung Galaxy Tab and other popular tablets.
pros: Adjustable height ensures you can use the floor stand while sitting, standing, lying down or exercising
Includes a detachable and expandable tablet holder with non-slip pads so you can instantly adjust the stand's angle, orientation and position
cons: Stand can be shaky at times
Bracket that holds the tablet in place is less than ideal

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy if you plan to interact with the tablet ...
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy if you plan to interact with the tablet. The top half is a flimsy plastic that shakes when someone walks by. A light tap on the tablet will cause it to shake for about a minute. While most tablet stands shake some, this was unbearable.
customer_reviews.author: C Hill

customer_reviews.title: Broke can't fix it
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. It has made the lazy part of my life even lazier an easier. I simply use it to view my tablet while in bed as a television screen. Definitely a 5-star product except that it doesn't hold up to standard use. A very small plastic connector bit on mine is broken, and it looks like the company doesn't Supply replacement parts. I bought it October 2016 it broke August 2017, lasted me almost a year.
customer_reviews.author: Connudatus

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable
customer_reviews.text: The piece that grips onto the tablet is weak and there is no way to lock that part down. It simply pinches and catches on the mating joint. This makes the whole tablet spin upside down or sag to one side. Maybe the phillip's head screws are supposed to tighten but mine are stripped and simply spin. I don't know why people are saying the base is great either. It is heavy but not heavy enough that my 40-pound dog can't tip it over simply by wagging her tail against it. It also was missing the ring piece at the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money. The top holder & knobs  will break because they are made out of plastic.
customer_reviews.text: Everything is built okay except the mounting assembly were the IPad Pro mounts. That unfortunately is made out of plastic and will break after 1 year to 1.5 years as mine has. The idea is great but just like every other company they have to cut production cost at the customers expense. Mine was originally $69.95 now that it is 89.95 I will not waste or purchase a piece of plastic. I will design a piece of wood to replace the broken part and sell it on here for $20.00. The only maintenance will be adjusting the tension screws.
customer_reviews.author: Rwberg

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 in April 2019 and used almost daily since and 1 broke on October 19, 2019🤷‍♀️...update the 2nd one broke on March 2020. Both less than 1 year later.
customer_reviews.author: Camper

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts & no customer service
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with essential part missing so product is unuseable. Have been emailing the email supplied on product leaflet for over a week now but haven't heard anything back from seller. They mentioned missing parts on leaflet so it must be a regular occurrence. Waste of money on a product that i can't use without my tablet falling on the ground. Very disappointed. This is the first bad review ive ever left but had to as i now have a brilliant product that doesnt function.
customer_reviews.author: Elle

customer_reviews.title: Yes, these do dramatically fail at some point... watch your head!
customer_reviews.text: Mine lasted about 4 years with lots of care to avoid stressing the weak plastic joint at the back of the jaws. The joint did fail, as noted by others. I was surprised at the suddenness of the failure; took no effort at all; the tablet with jaws attached was just suddenly loose in my hand. Fortunately the tablet was not above me when the joint failed. Too bad replacement parts are not available and too bad the vendor has chosen not to redesign this portion of the holder over the last 4 years.... off to find something else and figure out what to do with the pieces that remain.
customer_reviews.author: AB25

customer_reviews.title: Sturdiest base out of any of the tablet floor stands ...
customer_reviews.text: Sturdiest base out of any of the tablet floor stands i have dealt with. It allows me to sit and read wherever i chose to without needing to hold my tablet in a way that irritates muscles in my back into knotting up. I hestitated for a long time whether to get this one or others due to the reviews exposing the design flaw at the point of connection with the tablet to the arm and finally decided "They said they got over a year of use out of this? I'll just add the 4 year warranty to the cart and if that breaks i'll have it covered i guess".
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Well, not good for me.
customer_reviews.text: Maybe, first my fault. My mis-calculation about the height. The reason I bought this, I wanted to watch movies/Youtube/dramas via my iPad while I'm on my bed and relaxing. Maybe my bed unlikely lower than any other beds, I forgot to think ahead before I purchased this. So it was taller than I expected. I'm kinda lazy to return it, because It's heavy and I have to dis-assemble those. So I'm just using it at my kitchen when I'm cooking. But If I had bought it Costco or anywhere near my home, I might already have returned it. And it's not 360 degree, only horizontally 180 degree, i guess. It doesn't tilt down or up. I'm regretting it.

customer_reviews.title: Works with all sizes of iPads
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for a work party where we were showing off a new app. We used this one at the door and some table top ones everywhere else, and I think that worked pretty well. This one definitely takes up some space as the arm is pretty long, so take that into account when planning. But it was easy to set up, easy to move around, and looked really sleek. We put an iPad pro in it at one point, as well as regular sized iPads, and I love the versatility. Definitely would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: elise

customer_reviews.title: Great for some purposes, but not if you plan to type.
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good product and many people have reviewed it, so I'm not going to go into deep detail. I just want to mention that this stand is great for tasks that don't require much tablet interaction. When you need to tap the screen, the stand jiggles your tablet for a couple of seconds. It's not the end of the world and it doesn't make the stand unusable, but it is a distraction and makes things like playing most games or typing frustrating. I still give it 4 stars because it is great for my main purposes- using it as a music stand and reading.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with 11” iPad Pro with pen
customer_reviews.text: This stand would be perfect except the jaws just miss opening wide enough to for the 11” iPad Pro to fit across the wide part Of the pad. We use the Apple pen constantly and need to be able to charge it. If the jaws would open another 1/4” it would work. So the jaws only work on the narrow part of the pad. This then blocks the charging area for the pen making the stand useless if you need to charge the pen.
customer_reviews.author: GreatDane

customer_reviews.title: This works for me
customer_reviews.text: I really love how this works. You do have to treat it carefully because it is plastic. I just use both hands to turn positions. But it holds my iPad Air firmly. It holds the position I put it in, I can type and text just fine. It pivots easily away if I want to get up. The base is sturdy so I don't feel like it will tip over. I will be interested down the road fo a better quality one but for now, I am good with this one.

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but good purchase for watching in bed

No issues with it tipping over or anything, base is very heavy

customer_reviews.title: I Love This Thing! I don't know how I ever lived without it...

customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Best Tablet Stand
customer_reviews.text: Without a doubt, THE ABSOLUTE BEST iPad/tablet stand on the market. I've researched them all and no other product comes close. The only limitation is thetension in the moveable arm (that, in turn, holds the iPad) is not tight enough to raise the device above a horizontal position. The only way to raise the iPad above the horizontal plane is to raise the telescopic stand itself. Otherwise, the stand is a very well made and sturdy (turning the rectangular base 90 degrees helps keep heavy devices from tipping).
customer_reviews.author: Bill S.

customer_reviews.title: Well made and works very well with my iPad
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product for an iPad Pro. As long as you keep the arm over the long way of the base all is well. If you swing the arm over the short deminsion of the base it will tend to tip. I added 32 pounds to the base and all is well. My iPad is in a case that adds a couple of pounds to the end of the arm giving it the advantage. I like the product and is meets my needs very well.

Going to try and Krazy Glue that piece, and if it works again, will update this review.

As another reviewer noted, I mostly just swivel it out of the way when in bed at night and then back over if I awaken and want to read for a bit. I have also used it at my recliner chair while watching TV and reading or playing games. It is a bit heavier than some, but of course more stable as a result. Very adjustable and very sturdy. I highly recommend.
